Sentencas: Direct carbon fuel cells (DCFC) that employ solid oxide electrolytes and molten Sb anodes are promising for the efficient generation of electricity using a range of carbonaceous fuels.
Titulo: Effect of grain boundary diffusion on electrolyte stability in direct carbon fuel cells with antimony anodes

Sentencas: The present study examined the etching of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and gadolinia-doped ceria (GDC) electrolytes by Sb2O3 produced during fuel-cell operation.
Titulo: Effect of grain boundary diffusion on electrolyte stability in direct carbon fuel cells with antimony anodes

Sentencas: Migration of Sb along grain boundaries and electrolyte corrosion were observed for both polycrystalline YSZ and GDC electrolytes; however, corrosion and electrolyte thinning were not observed for a single crystal YSZ electrolyte, even after long-term operation.
Titulo: Effect of grain boundary diffusion on electrolyte stability in direct carbon fuel cells with antimony anodes

Sentencas: These results indicate that Sb migration along grain boundaries plays a significant role in electrolyte corrosion in DCFCs with molten Sb anodes.
Titulo: Effect of grain boundary diffusion on electrolyte stability in direct carbon fuel cells with antimony anodes

Sentencas: Several strategies for avoiding this problem are also discussed.
Titulo: Effect of grain boundary diffusion on electrolyte stability in direct carbon fuel cells with antimony anodes
